meanings.definition: Relating to the measurement of shape and size.
meanings.sent1: The morphometric analysis showed the differences in sizes of the leaves.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use morphometric tools to study the shapes of different rocks.
meanings.sent3: The morphometric ruler decided the winner of the 'biggest cookie' contest.
meanings.sent4: Her morphometric eyes could instantly assess the dimensions of any object.
meanings.sent5: The morphometric measurements were so precise that even the smallest details were captured.

meanings.definition: The branch of biology that deals with the measurement of the form of organisms.
meanings.sent1: In biology class, we learned about morphometric and its importance in studying organisms.
meanings.sent2: The scientist specialized in morphometric and conducted research on various species.
meanings.sent3: The morphometric expert could tell the species of a bird just by looking at its shape.
meanings.sent4: The field of morphometric allowed researchers to understand the diversity of living beings.
meanings.sent5: Through morphometric, the biologist could compare the forms of different animals accurately.
